title: Task 1: Identify selected object
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does not provide two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art.
Response provides two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art.

title: Task 2: Describe visual characteristics of a work of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Task 3: Describe visual characteristics of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe VISUAL characteristics of the selected work.
Response accurately describes ONE VISUAL characteristic of the selected work.

title: Task 4: Explain how two or more works of art are similar in how they convey meaning.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT use accurately use specific visual evidence from both works to explain a similarity in how both works convey concepts about ideal human qualities.
Response accurately uses visual evidence from both works to explain ONE similarity in how both works convey concepts about ideal human qualities.

title: Task 5: Explain how two or more works of art are different in how they convey meaning.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT use accurately use specific visual evidence from both works to explain a difference in how both works convey concepts about ideal human qualities.
Response accurately uses visual evidence from both works to explain ONE difference in how both works convey concepts about ideal human qualities.

title: Task 6: Articulate a defensible claim that explains the meaning or significance of similarities or differences between two works of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately explain a similarity OR difference in how the wall plaque from Oba’s palace and one comparison object express the values or beliefs of the society in which each work was created.

Response accurately explains ONE similarity OR difference in how the wall plaque from Oba’s palace and one comparison object express the values or beliefs of the society in which each work was created.

title: Task 7: Explain how the evidence justifies the claim.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe an example of contextual or iconographical evidence about byeri to support the explanation of a similarity OR difference in how both works express the values or beliefs of the society in which each work was created.

Response accurately describes ONE example of contextual OR iconographical evidence about byeri to support the explanation of a similarity OR difference in how both works express the values or beliefs of the society in which each work was created.

title: Task 8: Explain how the evidence justifies the claim.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe an example of contextual or iconographical evidence about the selected work to support the explanation of a similarity OR difference in how both works express the values or beliefs of the society in which each work was created.

Response accurately describes ONE example of contextual OR iconographical evidence about the comparison object to support the explanation of a similarity OR difference in how both works express the values or beliefs of the society in which each work was created.
